title: As Turkey Captures Territory in Syria, Kurds Head to Iraq
text:
President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Turkey had seized significant territory in Syria, a week after launching a military offensive that has drawn global condemnation and forced tens of thousands of people to flee their homes.

Mr. Erdogan said Tuesday that Turkish troops now controlled 1,000 square kilometers, or about 386 square miles, of territory in northeastern Syria and would continue to press the campaign toward securing a region stretching 300 miles, between the city of Manbij and the border with Iraq.

...
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Turkey had seized significant territory in Syria, a week after launching a military offensive that has drawn global condemnation and forced tens of thousands of people to flee their homes.
